III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 5/13/23, one youth was able to obtain staff keys and allowed
another youth out of their room. The youth that was allowed out of
their room self-harmed. They were transported to the hospital for a
psychiatric evaluation.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
05/26/2023.
The Complainant contacted on 05/26/2023, no additional
information was provided.
I interviewed Consumer Rights Officer at the facility on
05/26/2023. He reported there was an incident on 05/13/2023,
involving Youth A grabbing staff’s keys out of his hand and
opening the wing door. He said Youth A also opened the wing
door to two other youths. The three youths were in the hallway
that connected the three wings. The police were contact and help
get the Youth A and B on the wing, and Youth C was transported
to the hospital for psychiatric evaluation due to trying to self-harm.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 05/26/2023. Youth A is 14
years old and has been at the facility for 10 months. Youth A
reported that on 05/13/2023, she was upset and didn’t want to go
to sleep, so she grabbed Staff’s 4 keys out of his hand and
opened her wing door, and the wing doors for Youth B and C. She
said there were two staff members on her wing. She and the other
two youths were in the hallway of the building. She said staff
attempted talking to her to go back to her wing, but she refused so
staff called the police. Youth A did not see Youth C self-harm, but
she knows that Youth C went to the hospital. Youth A did not
express any concerns regarding staff or the facility.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 05/26/2023. Youth B is 15
years old. Youth B refused to answer any questions related to the
incident and walked out of the room.
I interviewed Youth C at the facility on 05/26/2023. Youth C is 16
years old and has been at the facility for one month. She reported
that on 05/13/2023, Youth A opened her wing door and she
followed Youth A to the hallway. She said Youth A was yelling and
that upset Youth C, so she took a piece metal from her
headphones and started to cut herself. She said there were
several staff members trying to calm Youth A and B down. She
stated staff called EMS and she was taken to the hospital due to
2

self-harming. Youth C said does see her therapist weekly and is
currently on 1:1 staffing due to self-harming. Youth C said there
was a staff member on her wing during the incident and she did
not express any concerns regarding staff supervision.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 05/31/2023. Staff 1 was the
assigned direct care worker to Youth A 05/13/2023. She reported
on 05/13/2023 Youth A was being very defiant, verbally
aggressive, and didn’t want to go to bed. She said Staff 5 was
standing by the staff’s desk holding his badge, Youth A snatched
his badge, ran, and opened the wing door. Youth A proceeded to
open two other wing doors, and Youth B and C also came out of
the units. Several staff members tried talking to Youth A, B, and C
to go back to their rooms, but Youth A and B were being very
defiant, so law enforcement was contacted to assist. Youth C was
triggered by the situation and sat on the floor and attempted to cut
herself. EMS was contacted, and Youth C was transported to the
hospital.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility on 05/31/2023. Staff 2 stated
she was contacted to assist with the “clear”. She saw Youth C
taking out a piece of metal from her bra and used to self-harm.
Staff 4 took the piece of metal from Youth C and EMS and the
police were contacted. Youth C was transported to the Hospital for
psychiatric evaluation.
I interviewed Staff 3 at the facility on 05/31/2023. Staff 3 reported
a clear was called due to Youth A grabbing Staff 5’s badge and
opening her wing door and the doors to two other wings. Staff 3
said Youth A and B were being very defiant and refusing to go
back on the wing, so law enforcement was contacted to assist.
Youth C sat on the floor and was self-harming. EMS and the
police were contacted. Youth C was transported to the hospital.
Youth A initially was being defiant, but after talking to her she
agreed to go back to her wing. Youth B continued to be defiant
and assaulted staff, and had to be restrained.
I interviewed Staff 4 at the facility on 05/31/2023. Staff 4 was the
assigned direct care worker to for Youth B. Staff 4 reported Youth
A snatched Staff 5’s badge, used the badge to open her wing door
and opened the wing door for Youth B. A clear was called and
staff attempted to redirect Youths back to their wings. Youth A and
B refused to cooperate, so law enforcement was contacted to
assist. Youth C broke her headphones and used a piece a metal
to self-harm, staff immediately took the metal piece and called
EMS.
3

I spoke with Consumer Rights Officer on 05/31/2023. He reported
Staff 5 resigned on 05/30/2023 due to being assaulted by a youth
on 05/30/2023, therefore Staff 5 was unable to be interviewed.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 05/13/2023 at 10:45pm for verbal and
physical aggression and self-harm was consistent with staff
interviews.
• Incident report dated 05/13/2023 at 11:40 pm, for physical
restraint. Youth B was being defiant, refusing to go back to
her room, and physically assaulted staff. Staff conducted a
CPI physical management from 11:40 pm to 11:43 pm.
• Staff 5 does not have disciplinary action in his personnel
records.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule as there is insufficient
evidence that staff were not supervising youths, based on
interviews with Staff, Youths, and documentation. Staff and Youth
reported Youth A grabbed staff’s keys out of their hand and
opened the wing door.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
